What a great idea! Yes, there are many songwriting apps and tools that can help you capture song ideas on the go. Here are a few options you might consider:

1. Voice Notes App: Most smartphones come with a built-in voice notes app that allows you to record audio notes. You can use this to hum a melody, record a lyrical idea, or even sing a rough demo of a song.
2. Evernote: A popular note-taking app that allows you to jot down lyrics, chord progressions, and ideas. You can also record audio notes and attach them to your written notes.
3. Songwriter's Pad: A dedicated songwriting app that offers a range of features, including a rhyming dictionary, chord chart library, and audio recorder.
4. Hookpad: A songwriting app that allows you to create and experiment with chord progressions, melodies, and lyrics.
5. Notes App (iOS) or Google Keep (Android): Simple, easy-to-use note-taking apps that are great for jotting down quick ideas and lyrics.
6. Hummingbird: A music notation app that allows you to create and edit sheet music, as well as record audio demos.

These are just a few examples, but there are many more songwriting apps available, depending on your specific needs and preferences.

Remember to keep your device charged and consider bringing a portable charger to the festival, so you don't run out of battery when inspiration strikes!
